title: 107_hr434
content: The "Emigrant Wilderness Preservation Act of 2001" is the short title of the Act. It pertains to the operation and maintenance of certain water impoundment structures in the Emigrant Wilderness, Stanislaus National Forest, California. The Secretary of Agriculture will enter into a cooperative agreement with a non-Federal entity to maintain and operate water impoundment structures in the Emigrant Wilderness, Stanislaus National Forest, California. The structures include Cow Meadow Lake, Y-Meadow Lake, Huckleberry Lake, Long Lake, Lower Buck Lake, Leighton Lake, High Emigrant Lake, and Emigrant Meadow Lake. The Secretary of Agriculture will prepare a map identifying water impoundment structures in the Emigrant Wilderness, Stanislaus National Forest, California. Eligible entities for the cooperative agreement include non-profit organizations, the State of California, and private individuals or organizations. The Secretary will prescribe terms for a cooperative agreement regarding water impoundment structures in the Emigrant Wilderness. The agreement will require the non-Federal entity to operate and maintain the structures according to an approved plan, obtain approval for all activities from the Secretary, and comply with environmental regulations. The non-Federal entity must comply with environmental regulations and operate and maintain water impoundment structures according to the cooperative agreement. The non-Federal entity must comply with environmental regulations and operate and maintain water impoundment structures according to the cooperative agreement. The agreement prohibits the use of mechanized transport and motorized equipment for operating or maintaining the structures in the Emigrant Wilderness. The Secretary of Agriculture may expand the agreement to cover additional structures with consent from the State of California and the other party. Authorization of Appropriations.-- $20,000 is authorized to cover administrative costs for compliance with the National Environmental Policy Act in carrying out the agreement between the State of California and the Secretary of Agriculture. The House of Representatives passed the bill on September 10, 2001.
